title: 107_s336
content: Cash Accounting for Small Business Act of 2001 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to prohibit an eligible taxpayer from being required to use an accrual method of accounting for a taxable year if the such taxpayer's average annual gross receipts for the preceding three-year period does not exceed $5 million . States that eligible small business taxpayers shall not be required to use inventories, and that property shall be treated as a material which is not incidental.
